title: Defining default argument with undefined tensor (Tensor x = {}) leads to static initialization order fiasco
body_html:
If you trigger this, you may see test failure like this:

======================================================================
ERROR: test_RReLU (__main__.TestNN)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test/test_nn.py", line 3587, in <lambda>
    setattr(TestNN, test_name, lambda self, test=test: test(self))
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/pytorch-1/test/common_nn.py", line 653, in __call__
    self.test_noncontig(test_case, module, input)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/pytorch-1/test/common_nn.py", line 681, in test_noncontig
    output = test_case._forward(module, input)
  File "test/test_nn.py", line 234, in _forward
    return module(input)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 357, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/activation.py", line 91, in forward
    return F.rrelu(input, self.lower, self.upper, self.training, self.inplace)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/functional.py", line 715, in rrelu
    return torch._C._nn.rrelu(input, lower, upper, training)
RuntimeError: CPU backend type not enabled.

Or segfault on program exit, dying in Context destructor. Whether or not the failure happens will depend on your machine.

I'm working on fixing it.

Or segfault on program exit, dying in Context destructor. Whether or not the failure happens will depend on your machine.
I'm working on fixing it.
body:
If you trigger this, you may see test failure like this:

```
======================================================================
ERROR: test_RReLU (__main__.TestNN)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test/test_nn.py", line 3587, in <lambda>
    setattr(TestNN, test_name, lambda self, test=test: test(self))
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/pytorch-1/test/common_nn.py", line 653, in __call__
    self.test_noncontig(test_case, module, input)
  File "/var/lib/jenkins/pytorch-1/test/common_nn.py", line 681, in test_noncontig
    output = test_case._forward(module, input)
  File "test/test_nn.py", line 234, in _forward
    return module(input)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 357, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/activation.py", line 91, in forward
    return F.rrelu(input, self.lower, self.upper, self.training, self.inplace)
  File "/opt/conda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/nn/functional.py", line 715, in rrelu
    return torch._C._nn.rrelu(input, lower, upper, training)
RuntimeError: CPU backend type not enabled.
```

Or segfault on program exit, dying in Context destructor. Whether or not the failure happens will depend on your machine.

I'm working on fixing it.
